definition: all taboos are off (idiom); anything goes/nothing is taboo
to be jealous of/fear/dread/scruple/to avoid or abstain from/to quit/to give up sth

sentences.english: You just play the game freely and with enthusiasm and enjoy it.
sentences.chinese: 现在要的就是百无禁忌的去享受比赛。

sentences.english: Alcohol is ( a ) taboo in this tribe.
sentences.chinese: 言外之意就是百无禁忌。

sentences.english: She's direct, warm, noisy and uninhibited TOO.
sentences.chinese: 她直接，热情，大声喧哗，百无禁忌。

definition: taboo/to avoid as taboo/to abstain from
to avoid a taboo word or topic
to avoid a taboo word or topic/to refrain from/to avoid
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
lit. laughs, jeers, anger and invective (idiom)/fig. all kinds of emotions/to mock and scold/(of writing) freely roving/following the author's fancy
to include impromptu comic material in opera performance (idiom); to jest/buffoonery
not to the point/wide of the mark/neither here nor there/irrelevant
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
to dismiss with a laugh/to make light of
